CHAPTER XLV.

OF THE PIPE.

YoU make also the pipe for the chalice in this manner. Make â€™ an iron in length a palm and four fingers, which at one end must be very fine and must continue increasing to the other extremity, which must be like a. straw3 and let the iron be round and smoothly filed. And when you have thinned some pure silver, sold it round this iron, joining the ends smoothly with a file, and taking off the iron, place it in the fire, and solder it. Again placing the iron in it, beat it with the hammer equally over all until the join is no longer visible.
